noun.description: The action or an act of revealing something; revelation; disclosure.

origin: Late 16th century; earliest use found in George Whetstone (d. 1587), writer. From reveal + -ment. Compare Old French revellement, Anglo-Norman and Middle French, French † revelement (sporadically attested between 1300 and 1611), Old Occitan revelamen, Spanish † revelamiento, Italian † rivelamento.
